subject: Re: [junit] suite(): good or bad?
msgSnippet: I use suite() methods almost always. It makes it easy for me to combine suites in ad hoc fashion, and I can run them with or without ant.

Subject: Re: [junit] suite(): good or bad?

I use suite() methods almost always. It makes it easy for me to
combine suites in ad hoc fashion, and I can run them with or without
ant.
